title_sort: walt whitman to susan stafford, 21–22 july 1888
title: Walt Whitman to Susan Stafford, 21–22 July 1888
text: CamdenSaturday AfternoonJuly 21 '88 Rather easier to-day—am writing a little & at my proofs (the little new book "Nov: Boughs")—have just rec'd three letters, one from my English friend Ernest Rhys, friend of Herbert Gilchrist, and one from Dr Bucke—Nothing special, but I will enclose them all (as I believe you are entertain'd—like I am by such)—I wish you to send the three back to me in the envelope—write a line to tell how you all [got] back—I liked your visit—have enjoy'd the chicken—did you get back all right? did you get the money all right at the bank?—pleasant weather here to-day—cloudy—Sunday noon July 22Am sitting up by the window—a little headache, & heavy feeling—but I must take the thick with the thin—moderately cool & rainy—very bearable for July—I am comfortable—good spirits— Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Susan Stafford, 21–22 July 1888
